detailed_results.input: The financial system can guarantee that an unauthorized transaction will never be executed.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that it will keep running the cycle until a stop is requested.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (<<Cobot>>) and same until structure (U) with the same stop condition; 'running_cycle' is a clear alias of 'cycle_running' from the sentence.

detailed_results.input: The rover can guarantee that if communication with the base is lost, then sooner or later it will activate the backup antenna.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Rover) and same temporal structure: globally, if communication is lost then eventually the backup antenna is activated. The predicate name difference (backup_antenna_on vs backup_antenna Activated) is a clear alias/spacing variation for the same proposition.

detailed_results.input: The user can guarantee that they will continue attempting payment until it is completed.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires that until payment is completed, payment is not yet completed (!paid U paid). The prediction instead requires a separate proposition paying to hold until paid, which is not equivalent to !paid unless explicitly defined; it changes the state condition enforced before completion.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that if the grip fails, then sooner or later it will retry.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Cobot) and same temporal structure G(grip_failed -> F ...). The predicate retry is a clear alias of retry_grip from the sentence context (retrying after a grip failure).

detailed_results.input: Robots number 1 and number 2 have a strategy to ensure that position 3 holds until position 4 holds and not position 5.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires both (pos3 U pos4) and !pos5 to hold (i.e., !pos5 globally along the path, including after pos4). Prediction instead requires !pos5 only at the moment pos4 becomes true (pos4 && !pos5), allowing pos5 to be true before or after that, so the meaning is weaker/different.

detailed_results.input: The management system can guarantee that it will never reject a valid request.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states globally that a valid request is never rejected (G !valid_request_rejected). The prediction instead is an implication with two separate global properties: (G !valid_request) -> (G !rejected). This changes meaning: it only guarantees no rejection if there are never any valid requests, and it forbids all rejections (even invalid ones) in the consequent. Temporal/connective structure is not equivalent.

detailed_results.input: The warehouse can guarantee that if a shelf is empty, then at the next step it will request restocking.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Warehouse) and same temporal structure G( -> X ). The predicate restocking_requested is a clear alias of restock_requested from the sentence, so meaning is preserved.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that if a human enters the area, then at the next step it will reduce speed.

Under strict semantics, these changes can alter the property.

detailed_results.input: The machine and the user together can guarantee that the ticket is printed before the system times out.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold uses an until: (!timeout U ticket_printed) meaning timeout must not occur up to the point when ticket_printed happens (and ticket_printed must eventually occur). Prediction is G(ticket_printed && !timeout), which requires ticket_printed to hold at all times (including immediately) and forbids timeout forever. This is much stronger and not equivalent to 'printed before timeout'.

detailed_results.input: The system can guarantee that there will never be false positives when calibration is valid.
detailed_results.reasoning: The condition is inverted. Gold requires: if calibration is valid/ok then always no false positives. Prediction uses !calibration_valid, meaning the guarantee applies when calibration is not valid, which changes the property.

detailed_results.input: The user can guarantee that at the next step there will be no error and that this condition will always remain true.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires that from the next state onward, !error holds globally (X G !error). Prediction only enforces !error at the next state and that from the current state onward !error holds globally (X(!error && G !error) = X!error && XG!error), which is weaker than XG!error because it does not ensure !error at the state immediately after the next one.

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that the gate will never open without payment.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states: always, if not paid then gate is not open (<<Machine>>G(!paid -> !gate_open)). Prediction parses as (<<Machine>>G !paid) -> (G !gate_open), an implication between two global properties, not a single globally enforced conditional. This is weaker/different: it only requires G !gate_open when G !paid holds, and says nothing when payment sometimes occurs.

detailed_results.input: The smart city system can guarantee that if an intersection is congested, then at the next step it will retime the traffic lights.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (CitySystem) and same temporal structure G( p -> X q ). Predicate names are reasonable aliases: intersection/junction congested and retiming traffic lights.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 1 and number 2 have a strategy to ensure eventually position 1 and always position 3 afterwards.

Prediction instead requires pos3 to start holding globally only from the next step after reaching pos1 (F(pos1 && X G pos3)), allowing pos3 to be false at the pos1 state. This changes the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The smart grid can guarantee that if demand increases, then at the next step it will increase production.
detailed_results.reasoning: The antecedent predicate differs: gold uses demand_high (demand increases/high), while prediction uses demand_increased. This changes the condition under which the next-step production increase must be guaranteed, so the meaning is not preserved.

detailed_results.input: Aye, aye! and I’ll chase him round Good Hope, and round the Horn, and round the Norway Maelstrom, and round perdition’s flames before I give him up. And this is what ye have shipped for, men! to chase that white whale on both sides of land, and over all sides of earth, till he spouts black blood and rolls fin out.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states that agent I can ensure chasing continues until the enemy both spouts black blood and rolls fin out (a conjunction as the U-target). Prediction changes the agent (Ishmael vs I), adds an always operator G, and changes the until target to only blood_spouted while separating G chase_white_whale with &&, which is not equivalent to chase U (blood_spouted && rolls_fin_out).

detailed_results.input: The Romans, in the countries which they annexed, observed closely these measures; they sent colonies and maintained friendly relations with the minor powers, without increasing their strength; they kept down the greater, and did not allow any strong foreign powers to gain authority.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction changes the meaning by adding and altering conjuncts. The gold requires globally (send-colony && friendly_with_minor_powers && keep_down_the_greater). The prediction instead uses (colonies_sent && friendly_relations && strength_down && no_strong_foreign_powers): it omits the explicit 'keep down the greater' predicate (replacing it with a different 'strength_down'), and adds an extra condition about strong foreign powers not gaining authority. These are not clear aliases and change the expressed property.

detailed_results.input: The world’s stable now. People are happy; they get what they want, and they never want what they can’t get. They’re well off; they’re safe; they’re never ill; they’re not afraid of death; they’re blissfully ignorant of passion and old age; they’re plagued with no mothers or fathers; they’ve got no wives, or children, or lovers to feel strongly about; they’re so conditioned that they practically can’t help behaving as they ought to behave.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states only that the World can guarantee stability always (<<World>>G stable). The prediction strengthens the property to require many additional always-true conditions (happy, safe, not ill, etc.) and does not even include stable. This changes the expressed meaning.
